articles.author: Hyunsu Yim, Josh Smith
articles.description: North Korea for the first time showed images of the centrifuges that produce fuel for its nuclear bombs on Friday, as leader Kim Jong Un visited a uranium enrichment facility and called for more weapons-grade material to boost the arsenal.
articles.title: North Korea shows first photos of banned uranium enrichment site

articles.author: Laurie Chen
articles.description: China's defence minister said on Friday that China would enhance military ties with its neighbours, saying major countries had to take a lead in safeguarding global security.
articles.title: China's defence minister asks major countries to take lead in safeguarding global security

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A Russian missile hit a civilian vessel carrying grain from Ukraine that had already left Ukrainian waters in the Black Sea, President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said on Thursday.
articles.title: Russian missile hit civilian ship carrying Ukrainian grain in Black Sea, Zelenskiy says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Israeli military on Thursday named nine men it said were Hamas militants killed in Gaza airstrikes that the U.N. Palestinian refugee agency UNRWA said had left six of its staffers dead.
articles.title: Israel names Hamas gunmen it says were targeted in strike that killed UNRWA staff

articles.author: Jesus Bustamante
articles.description: Authorities in the western Mexican state of Sinaloa on Thursday canceled national day celebrations and shut schools on the back of escalating violence stemming from internal Sinaloa Cartel fighting, which has left 12 people dead since Monday.
articles.title: Worsening Sinaloa Cartel war paralyzes life in Mexican city

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Philippine celebrity pastor Apollo Quiboloy, the self-proclaimed "Appointed Son of God", pleaded not guilty on Friday to a charge of sex trafficking, his lawyer said.
articles.title: Philippine 'Son of God' preacher pleads not guilty to sex trafficking charge

articles.author: Renju Jose
articles.description: Elon Musk, owner of social media platform X, on Friday called Australia's centre-left government "fascists" over proposed legislation to slap fines on social media firms for failing to prevent the spread of misinformation online.
articles.title: Musk calls Australian government 'fascists' over misinformation law

articles.author: Diadie Ba
articles.description: Senegal President Bassirou Diomaye Faye on Thursday dissolved the opposition-led national assembly, clearing the way for early legislative elections on Nov. 17.
articles.title: Senegal's president sets parliament election on Nov. 17

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A Georgia judge on Thursday dismissed two criminal counts in the U.S. state's 2020 election interference case against Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump and one other count against allies of the former president.
articles.title: Georgia judge dismisses two criminal counts against Trump, court filing shows

articles.author: Yimou Lee
articles.description: As tropical storm Bebinca barrels towards waters off northern Taiwan gathering strength into a possible typhoon, weather forecasters in Taipei are using a new and so far successful method to help track its path - artificial intelligence (AI).
articles.title: As storm Bebinca approaches, Taiwan uses AI to predict typhoon paths
